channel.title: plaincode - app development + tech blog
channel.description: News and updates from plaincode - mobile app development for iOS and Android

item.title: Website Relaunch: New Modern Design & Enhanced Performance
item.description:
We're excited to announce the complete relaunch of our website with a stunning new design! The site now features a modern glassmorphism aesthetic with our Bavaria Blue theme, delivering a fresh, professional look that's fast and responsive across all devices.

What's New: Modern glassmorphism design with beautiful frosted glass effects, lightning-fast performance with migration from WordPress to static site, enhanced mobile experience with fully responsive design, and privacy-focused cookie-free analytics with full GDPR compliance.

item.title: Clinometer App Releases Version 3.0 for Android: Enhanced Compatibility and Stability
item.description:
We are excited to announce the release of Clinometer App Version 3.0 for Android devices. This major update brings full compatibility with the latest Android operating systems and introduces crucial stability fixes to enhance user experience.

Clinometer has long been a trusted tool for professionals and hobbyists alike, providing precise angle and slope measurements typically within ±0.1 degrees.

item.title: Barometer iOS App updated
item.description: Barometer updated to fix the access to the barometer sensor. Due to the iOS 17 update, apps need to request permission to motion and fitness related data.

item.title: iContacts+ app updated for iOS14 to version 2.8
item.description: A required update of the iContacts+ is now rolled out as version 2.8. In iOS14 the old API was not supported anymore and the updated app uses the modern Contact framework.

item.title: Updates released for iOS 13 with dark mode support – Working on new features
item.description: After updating all of our apps to support dark mode and all current iPhone/iPad models, we are working on new features in Clinometer. Stay tuned!

item.title: Added support for iPad Pro, iPhone XS and iPhone XR
item.description: The clinometer app was updated to support all the new devices. We are also working on new features / options, stay tuned.

item.title: iPhone X & iOS 11 Updates
item.description: All the Sensor Utility apps are now updated for iPhone X & iOS 11. All our other apps will also receive an update shortly.

item.title: Clinometer v3.7 with new unit mode (V:H), new theme (bigger dial) and localized speech synthesis!
item.description: Clinometer v3.7 brings exciting new features including a new unit mode (V:H), a new theme with a bigger dial for better visibility, and localized speech synthesis for enhanced accessibility!

item.description: MagicHue is now compatible with the iPad, bringing the full color control experience to the larger screen.

item.title: Clinometer Pro now available on Android Market
item.description: After over 250,000 downloads of the free version, our pro version of Clinometer is now in the Android Market. This version can be calibrated and adds support for tablet devices where the orientation is different. Thanks for your support!

item.title: iSetSquare (iGeodreieck) available on the App Store!
item.description: iSetSquare (iGeodreieck), available on the App Store! This is designed exclusive for iPhone 4 using the retina display and the new gyroscope sensor to their limits.

item.title: HD apps available on the iPad App Store!
item.description: Clinometer HD, MagnetMeter HD and Spin The Bottle HD available on the iPad App Store! All are available for free until they are updated to universal apps! Clinometer HD had a jump start and is currently in the TOP 100 of all free apps at place 57.

item.title: MagnetMeter and AccelMeter available on the App Store!
item.description: MagnetMeter and AccelMeter available on the App Store! The world's first Vector Magnetometer on the iPhone 3GS for one buck. The AccelMeter is available for free!

item.title: Welcome to the source of plain code!
item.description: Welcome to the source of plain code! Usually we operate in the background and develop business to business applications in the web context, but recently we found a taste on end-user products. The iPhone is the ideal platform to test new user applications and experiences.
